text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that wil, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
 While Mr.Ade is his son is a novice.
explanation:
Novice: a person new to and inexperienced in a job or situation.
Experienced:having gained knowledge or skill in a particular field over time.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that wil, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
It is better to use persuasion rather than .... to get witnesses to court.
explanation:
The speaker is advising to use a method other than "persuasion" to get witnesses to court. The word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to "persuasion" is "coercion."
"Persuasion" involves convincing or influencing someone through reasoning or argument, often with the aim of gaining their voluntary cooperation. On the other hand, "coercion" implies the use of force or threats to make someone do something against their will.
So, the sentence suggests that it is better to use persuasion (convincing or influencing) rather than coercion (force or threats) to get witnesses to court. Therefore, option B, "coercion," is the correct choice.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that wil, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
The animosity between Fatou and Sheku is shocking, considering the ...... they once shared.
explanation:
Animosity: strong hostility.
Fiendship: the emotions or conduct of friends; the state of being friends.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that wil, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence
. The reckless driver was admonished to be ______
explanation:
Reckless: heedless of danger or the consequences of one's actions; rash or impetuous.
Cautious:careful to avoid potential problems or dangers.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that wil, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
The old man rebuked the thug and his children  .... him for doing so.
explanation:
Rebuked: express sharp disapproval or criticism of (someone) because of their behaviour or actions.
Commended: praise formally or officially.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that wil, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
All divers were enjoined to obtain genuine and ______ licences.
explanation:
Genuine: truly what something is said to be; authentic.
Fake: not genuine; imitation or counterfeit.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that wil, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
There was agitation for the .......... law on libel to be re-enacted.
explanation:
Re-enacted: bring (a law) into effect again when the original statute has been repealed or has expired.
Repealed: revoke or annul (a law or act of parliament).

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
The two political parties live today in ... after four years of hostility.
explanation:
Hostility: hostile behaviour; unfriendliness or opposition.
Amity: friendly relations.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
The champions were elated after the tournament while their opponents looked _______
explanation:
Elated: ecstatically happy.
Dejected: sad and depressed; dispirited.

text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
That engineer was said to have used inferior than _____ materials in the construction of the collapsed building.
explanation:
Inferior: lower in rank, status, or quality.
Excellent: extremely good; outstanding.

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences.
.I could not read what he wrote because his handwriting was_____
explanation: illegible: not clear enough to be read.

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences.
When all the items on the agenda had been discussed, the meeting was ______
explanation: This word means to formally end a meeting or session to resume it later or on another day. It is commonly used in the context of meetings where all planned discussions have been completed, making it the most appropriate choice here. Every meeting has an agenda - a list of items that need to be discussed. And when the items on the agenda have been discussed, the meeting is usually adjourned.

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences.
Occasionally, universities award _____ degrees to outstanding personalities.
explanation: Honorary: conferred as an honour, without the usual requirements or functions.

explanation: Belief: something one accepts as true or real; a firmly held opinion.

text:
choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence.
 So much effluent has been poured into the stream that its water has become unsafe for drinking.
explanation: In the sentence, "effluent" refers to waste or discharge, especially liquid waste or pollutants released into a body of water. It often includes substances from industrial processes or sewage systems. The word "sewage" is the closest in meaning to "effluent" in this context. Sewage refers to the waste matter, including human and household waste, carried away in sewers or drains. It commonly includes both liquid and solid waste. So, in the given sentence, the water in the stream has become unsafe for drinking due to the pouring of effluent, which is essentially sewage or pollutants.

choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
. After stalking its prey for a while, thé lion .... .or the kill.
Mary and Jane are always quarrelling with ______.
They have been informed of his departure ...?
Although some students may be innocent, ______are guilty of this offence.
explanation:
We're looking for a word thatcontrastswith "some students may be innocent" and correctly agrees with theplural noun "students".
Muchis used with uncountable nouns (e.g.,much water,much money). “Students” is countable.A great dealis also used with uncountable nouns (e.g.,a great deal of effort).Agood deal,like “great deal,” is used with uncountable nouns.
But “most” is used with countable nouns and fits this context.

text: She prefers singing ........ dancing
Is that the lady ........you planned to visit?
The children .........in the pool after school.
In spite of all their shortcomings, we cannot ... admire them.
The African extended family system gives .......members.
explanation: The word "its" is used to show possession or association with something that is considered singular and gender-neutral, such as "system" in this case.

text: We all look forward to meeting the ............
One of my . ..... is a lecturer in the university.
Regina pleaded with her son to ........ the habit of smoking.
Their proposal looks .......... than ours.
You will be none ....... for it if you take the examinations in November.
explanation:
The complete sentence is: "You will be nonethe worsefor it if you take the examinations in November."
The phrase "none the worse for" is a common idiom that means to not be harmed or damaged by something. This phrase, in this context, means that taking the exams in November will not make you any worse off.

text: Money serves as a ....71..... of exchange modern world.
This is perhaps the most important..... 72....... of money.
People who have money can use it to buy goods and....73... .
Without it, trade will be carried out on the basis of ...74.... where goods or services are exchanged as was the practice in the years gone by.
This mode of trading has a number of disadvantages, as people will have to match their .....75..... With those of other people.
For example, if a hunter wants to trade his ....76... for yam,
explanation: The passage discusses trade in a traditional setting, where people exchanged goods before the use of money. The hunter in the example would trade something he has obtained through hunting i.e. his "kill". "Kill" here refers to the animal that has been hunted and killed by the hunter, it is this animal meat that he can trade for yams.

text: he must find a ..... 77... who needs what he is trading.
Another difficulty is determining the ....78..... of each item needed in the exchange.
International trade boosts the....79...of a nation.
The ...80..... frequently used in international trade is the US Dollar.

From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.
Many students ATTEND lectures everyday.

options.A: Do many students skip lectures everyday?
options.B: Do many students attend lectures every week?
options.C: Do many drivers attend lectures everyday?
options.D: Do many students attend concerts everyday?

options.D: Have William's parents received the letters?

text:

options.A: Were the third-year girls reprimanded by the principal?
options.B: Were the third-year girls commended by the doctor?
options.C: Were the third-year boys commended by the principal?
options.D: Were the first-year girls commended by the principal?

text:

Stephen SELDOM goes to the house.

options.A: Does James seldom go the house?
options.B: Does Stephen seldom go to the school?
options.C: Does Stephen often go to the house?
options.D: Does Stephen seldom leave the house?

text:
The word that receives the emphatic stress is in capital letters. From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence relates.
All the EMPLOYEES rejected him.

options.A: Did all the employees reject him
options.B: Did some of the employees reject him?
options.C: Did all the employees accept him?
options.D: Did all the employers reject him?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or phrase in a sentence or utterance. For questions on emphatic stress, the rule is to select the option that has a word that contradicts the emphasised word/ word in capital letters. In this case, the answer is option D. because it has "employers" instead of "employees". This makes sense because the sentence is the appropriate response to the question as it clarifies a misapprehension in the question:
Did all the employers reject him?
No. All the employees rejected him.
